intro: Lapsana musashiensis, commonly known as the Japanese hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
